III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112
Section (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
Description (a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/23/24, youth was assaultive towards staff to including
punching, kicking, and biting. It was also reported that staff hit the
youth and attempted to touch the youth's genitals. Youth pulled
their pants down during the incident threatening to defecate.
Youth reported having a knot in the back of their head after the
incident. Law Enforcement did not confirm a knot. Youth was
transferred to the hospital for psychiatric care.
Investigation Interviews:
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024. Staff 1 said on March 23, 2024, in the morning or early
afternoon Youth A had been making suicidal comments to staff,
ran away from the facility and staff followed him through the
woods. Staff 1 said as a result of his behaviors the police and
Emergency Medical Services (EMS) were called and Youth A was
transported to the hospital for an evaluation and released back to
the facility. Staff 1 said Youth A became escalated upon his return
to the facility and she was called down to unit three to assist staff
due to his behaviors. Staff 1 said when she arrived on the unit she
saw Youth A punching at staff and then Youth A laid on the ground
next to staff and put staff’s legs in between his legs in attempts to
get staff to fall to the ground. Staff 1 said Youth A got up and
began to run around the unit, jumping on beds and dressers, and
running to the doors in attempts to get out of the unit. Staff 1 said
Staff 6 took the other youth off the unit while she, Staff 2, Staff 4,
and Staff 5 stayed on the unit to deescalate Youth A. Staff 1 said
at one point Youth A got to a door and was able to get it open and
had his arm in the door. Staff 1 said she stood with her foot
propping the door steady so that it would not shut on Youth A’s
arm and the other staff were working on getting Youth A’s arm out
of the doorway so they could close the door. Staff 1 said at no
point during that situation did Youth A’s arm get shut or pinched in
the doorway, however noted that Youth A did attempt to bite staff’s
legs and was screaming “break my arm”. Staff 1 said once they
were able to get Youth A’s arm out of the door he moved to the
middle of the unit and took off his shirt and threatening to wrap it
around staff to harm them. Staff 1 said Youth A moved over to
Staff 5 and put his back against the wall. Youth A wrapped his shirt
around Staff 5’s legs and attempted to pick Staff 5 up however
Staff 5 was able to get out of the situation. Staff 1 said she and the
other staff were keeping distance from Youth A by standing by
doorways to prevent him from getting off the unit due to his issues
earlier that day and the ongoing suicidal statements he was
making as well as the threats to kill his peers. Staff 1 said Youth A
started to run around the unit again and pulled his pants down
2

threatening to defecate on peers beds. Staff 1 said during this
period of time Youth A was screaming out allegations of staff
hitting and punching him as well as sexually molesting him when
his pants were down however staff were never near him doing any
of these things to him. Staff 1 said she finally called the police as
Youth A did not show signs of calming down. Staff 1 said Youth A
began to ask to use the bathroom and was told he was able to if
he could show he would be safe by calming down. If not, he would
need to keep the door open so staff could ensure his safety while
he used the bathroom due to his suicidal statements. Youth A
refused either option and said he was going to urinate in a
trashcan instead. Staff 1 said once the police arrived Youth A
willingly went into the bathroom with police supervision. Staff 1
said Youth A told the police that Staff 4 hit him in the head and the
officer looked at Youth A’s head and did not say anything. Staff 1
said she never saw any staff hit Youth A in the head or kick him in
the chest. Staff 1 said the EMS arrived and transported Youth A to
the hospital and Staff 3 rode with him. Staff 1 said the incident
lasted about an hour or more. There were so many behaviors
Youth A exhibited throughout the time. Staff were trying to ensure
safety and try to verbally deescalate him, noting no physical
restraint was used with Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024. Youth A struggled to remember the sequence of events
and had difficulty recounting events during the interview. Youth A
said he was very upset that he had to be at the facility on his
birthday. Youth A said he had some suicidal thoughts and
behaviors in the morning and early afternoon on his birthday and
he was brought to the hospital for an evaluation. Youth A said he
wanted to go to a psychiatric hospital however he was told he
needed to return to Clarence Fischer Center which made him
“very mad”. Youth A said once he got back to the facility from the
hospital he was on the unit and was feeling overwhelmed and
upset. He asked staff if he could go outside and was told no. Youth
A said he then asked to use the bathroom and was told no, stating
staff were standing in the bathroom doorway and would not allow
him into the bathroom. Youth A said he really needed to “poop”
and staff told him he had to wait. He threatened to use the
bathroom in his pants or on the floor of the unit and staff told him
“go ahead”. Youth A said he pulled his pants down, acting like he
was going to poop but never did. Youth A denied the staff being
near him when his pants were down and denied any staff
attempting or touching his genitals. Youth A said he then sat on
the floor and Youth C began to throw items at him. He tried to get
off the unit by crawling to the door. He was able to get the door
3

ajar and his arm through, but Staff 1 came over to the door and
began to push the door closed on his arm. Youth A said he got his
arm free and was lying by the doorway and Staff 2 walked over.
Youth A said he began to kick Staff 2 and Staff 2 responded by
kicking him in the chest. Youth A said at some point he flipped a
“few mattresses off beds” and staff threatened to restrain him
which made him move to the middle of the room. Youth A said
once in the middle of the common area Staff 2, Staff 4, and Staff 5
tried to restrain him and Staff 4 hit him in the back of his head with
a closed fist. Youth A said he screamed and started to cry and
Staff 4, Staff 2 and Staff 5 backed away from him. Youth A said he
has a “knot” on the back of his head from Staff 4 hitting him,
stating he is unsure if it was intentional. Youth A said the police
arrived at the facility and took over for the staff. Youth A said the
police looked at the bump on his head and stated, “that’s probably
a concussion”. Youth A said the EMS then arrived and took him to
the hospital. Youth A denied ever getting a physical exam by either
the EMS or the hospital staff. Youth A denied telling anyone about
the bruises on his arms or bump on the back of his head. Youth A
said he was at McClearn Caro hospital for three days waiting on a
psychiatric bed however one was never found so he was once
again brought back to the facility.
Youth B was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024. Youth B said he was placed on the same unit as Youth A
on March 23, 2024. Youth B said Youth A was “acting bad all day”
creating situations with other youth “back-to-back”. Youth B said
Youth A was picking on him and the other youth by threatening to
kill them, break all of their things, and talking about their dead
family members. Youth B said Youth A was jumping on the tables
and hitting staff. Youth B said he never saw the staff restrain Youth
A. Youth B said he never saw any staff hit or kick Youth A. Youth B
said he did not have any concerns about the way that staff were
interacting with Youth A. Youth B said Youth A is now placed on a
different unit.
Youth C was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024. Youth C said he was on Youth A’s unit on March 23,
2024. Youth C said Youth A was threatening several of the youth
on the unit that day including him. Youth C said Youth A
threatened to kill him. Youth C said Youth A threatened to “pee” in
Youth B’s mouth, was throwing items at Youth B, was threatening
to kill another youth, and was jumping on Youth B’s bed saying he
was going to “shit all over it”. Youth C said Youth A was at the
hospital earlier that day and when he got back, he was “even
worse”. Youth C said Youth A was pulling the fire alarms, throwing
4

DVD’s across the room at youth, hitting staff, and started to “talk
shit” about Youth C’s dead brother and Youth B’s dead mother.
Youth C said he never saw staff hit or kick Youth A, stating Youth A
was kicking and hitting all the staff. Youth C said he did not have
any concerns about the way in which staff were interacting with
Youth A.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024. Staff 2 said he was working on March 23, 2024, with
Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A was sitting on the unit talking to staff
and eating his dinner when he suddenly started throwing his food,
flipping furniture, and was yelling and cussing at staff and peers.
Staff 2 said he was not positive on the exact sequence of events
with Youth A as there were so many things he did over the course
of about an hour. Staff 2 said the main goal that staff had was to
verbally deescalate and keep him from getting outside due to the
issue he had prior in the day and the statements he was making
about killing his peer and himself. Staff 2 said Staff 1, Staff 4, and
Staff 5 all were working with Youth A to calm him down. Staff 2
said Staff 6 took all the rest of the youth off the unit and away from
Youth A. Staff 2 said Youth A was jumping on furniture, flipping
over furniture, running at staff and pushing them, crawling on the
ground attempting to get through staff’s legs, kicking and hitting
staff in the “private” areas, and pulling his pants down threatening
to urinate or defecate on his peer’s beds. Staff 2 said Youth A was
screaming that the facility was unfair and showed certain youth
favoritism, screaming that staff were punching him when no one
was near him, and yelling that staff were raping him when he
pulled his pants down despite staff being several feet away from
him. Staff 2 said staff did not restrain Youth A throughout the
duration of the hour and were using proximity control by moving
away from him when he would come close to them in attempts to
hit or kick them. Staff 2 denied ever seeing Staff 4 or any other
staff hit Youth A. Staff 2 denied kicking Youth A in the chest or any
other staff kicking Youth A. Staff 2 denied ever seeing Youth A get
his arm in the door or any staff pushing a door closed on Youth A’s
arm. Staff 2 said Youth A was very escalated and was trying to
hurt peers, staff, and himself and therefore staff were concerned
with him getting out of the unit and harming himself or others. Staff
2 said the police arrived at the facility and Youth A seemed to calm
down a little bit. When the ambulance arrived, he was much
calmer and willingly went to the hospital.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on March
27, 2024. Staff 3 said she was not involved in the incident on the
unit with Youth A however did go with him in the ambulance to the
5

hospital to be evaluated. Staff 3 said Youth A was evaluated in the
ambulance by the emergency medical staff (EMS) as well as by
nurses at the hospital while she was with him. Staff 3 said Youth A
showed the EMS the bruise on his arm stating it was from his arm
being pinched in a door, and a lump on his head but did not state
where that came from. Staff 3 said Youth A did participate in a
physical examination with both EMS and nurses. Staff 3 said the
nurses appeared “irritated” with Youth A as he had been in the
emergency room just that morning and released. Staff 3 said she
was at the hospital with Youth A for about three to four hours and
did not see a doctor come in to evaluate him. Staff 3 said Youth A
fell asleep about 9pm and she was relieved by another staff at
10pm.
Staff 4 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 4,
2024. Staff 4 said he was called to unit three on March 23, 2024,
for assistance with Youth A. Staff 4 said once he arrived on the
unit Youth A had thrown items all over the unit and was pacing
back and forth between staff attempting to kick and hit staff in their
genitals. Staff 4 said the incident with Youth A lasted at least an
hour and he was unsure of the exact sequence of events. Staff 4
said Youth A spent a lot of the time yelling and running around the
unit trying to destroy property, making suicidal threats, and threats
to kill his peers. Staff 4 said he and Staff 1, Staff 2, and Staff 5
kept using proximity control with Youth A keeping him in the unit,
blocking doors, and trying to ensure he did not get anything that
he could harm himself or other with. Staff 4 said Youth A crawled
under a staff’s legs and got a door open with his arm through the
door and began screaming that his arm was getting pinched. Staff
moved back while pulling his arm out of the door and closing it.
Staff 4 denied any staff shutting or pinching Youth A’s arm in the
door. Staff 4 said Youth A repeatedly pulled his pants down and
would scream that staff were touching him sexually however none
of the staff were close enough to touch him during these incidents.
Youth A dropped to the ground and began to attempt to crawl
through Staff 4’s legs. Staff 4 said he closed his leg to prevent
Youth A from getting underneath him and in doing so Youth A hit
his head on Staff 4’s knee and began to scream that Staff 4 had
punched him in the face. Staff 4 denied ever punching Youth A
stating that when Youth A began to yell, he backed away from
Youth A immediately. Staff 4 denied ever seeing Staff 2 or any
other staff kick Youth A, stating Youth A was the one that was
kicking all the staff. Staff 4 said Youth A did ask to use the
bathroom and was told he could as long as he either deescalated
to show safe behaviors or allowed a staff to be in the doorway in
order to ensure safety, Youth A refused either option. Staff 4 said
6

the police arrived and Youth A calmed down almost immediately.
Staff 4 said the police escorted Youth A to the bathroom where he
told them he did not need to go to the bathroom. Staff 4 said EMS
arrived and took Youth A back to the hospital for an evaluation.
Staff 4 said he did not have any concerns regarding any of the
staff interactions with Youth A during this incident.
Staff 5 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 4,
2024. Staff 5 said he was working on March 23, 2024, and was at
the hospital in the afternoon with Youth A. Staff 5 said Youth A was
complaining of being at the facility for his birthday and when the
hospital staff informed him he would be discharged back to
Clarence Fisher Center Youth A said he was going to “tweak out”
when he got back to the facility. Staff 5 said when they arrived
back at the facility the other youth had already eaten so he got
Youth A some food and brought it back to the unit. Staff 5 said
Youth A was sitting on the bed eating his dinner when all of a
sudden, he threw his tray across the room, flipped beds and
jumped on furniture. Staff 5 said he encourage and directed Youth
A to get down from the furniture. Youth A started to jump from bed
to bed and on tables and chairs. Staff 5 said Youth A then began
to tip the tables over and throw the chairs around. Staff 5 said
Youth A began to argue with some of his peers and threaten to kill
them if they came near him. Staff 5 said Youth A took off his shirt
and wrap it around his hands and threatened to beat staff up. Staff
5 said Staff 1 and Staff 4 were called to assist on the unit and
when they arrived Staff 6 took the rest of the youth off the unit.
Staff 5 said he and the other staff began to move things out of the
reach of Youth A so he could not jump on furniture or attempt to hit
staff with any of it. Staff 5 said Youth A was running around trying
to punch and kick staff in the genitals. Staff 5 said Youth A began
to crawl around on the ground and got to a door. He was able to
open it and get his arm through the doorway. Staff 5 said Staff 1
was holding the door steady while he and Staff 2 were trying to get
Youth A’s arm out of the doorway. Staff 5 denied any staff pushing
or pinching Youth A’s arm in the door. Staff 5 said eventually he
was able to unlock Youth A’s fingers from the door and get his arm
inside the unit and the door was shut. Staff 5 said Youth A then
tried to move to the back of the unit in order to get to another door
and he and Staff 4 were standing in the entryway to prevent him
from getting to the doorway when Youth A attempted to crawl in
between Staff 4’s legs. Staff 5 said Staff 4 moved his legs to
prevent Youth A from getting under him and when he did that
Youth A bumped the front of his head into Staff 4’s knees. Staff 5
said Youth A became upset, ran back into the sleeping area,
repeatedly pulled his pants down, and would scream that staff are
7

raping him. Staff 5 said staff were not close enough to Youth A
while his pants were down to be able to touch him. Staff 5 said he
never saw any staff sexually touch Youth A. Staff 5 said Youth A
was crawling near Staff 2 and began to attempt to bite his legs at
one point and Staff 2 pulled his legs away from Youth A. Staff 5
denied ever seeing Staff 2 or any other staff kick Youth A in the
chest or anywhere else. Staff 5 said Youth A started to say he
needed to use the bathroom and was told he either needed to
calm down or allow a staff to stand in the doorway to ensure his
safety. Youth A denied either option, pulling his pants down stating
he was going to urinate in the trash can. Staff 5 said the police
arrived and Youth A calmed down and was able to go in the
bathroom but then never even went to the bathroom. Staff 5 said
EMS arrived and transported Youth A back to the hospital. Staff 5
said he did not have any concerns about the way staff interacted
with Youth A during the incident.
Staff 6 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on April 4,
2024. Staff 6 said she was working on unit three on March 23,
2024, when Youth A returned from the hospital shortly after
dinnertime. Staff 6 said Youth A was sitting on the unit eating his
dinner when he suddenly “flipped out”, threw his dinner and began
to flip beds and jump from table to table. Staff 6 said Youth A
began to threaten the other youth and run after them like he was
going to attack them. Staff 6 said Youth A began to push staff, hit
staff with the stick from the dustpan, and attempt to get outside.
Staff 6 said Youth A kept saying he wanted “out” for his birthday
and was yelling and being very unsafe. Staff 6 said she, Staff 2
and Staff 5 put the other youth in the television area and were
trying to verbally deescalate Youth A however it was not
successful. Staff 6 said Youth B and Youth C kept running into the
sleeping area so Staff 1 and Staff 4 were called to assist and she
took all the other youth to the gym with another staff. Staff 6 said
while she was on the unit she did not see any staff hit, kick, or
sexually touch Youth A. Staff 6 said Youth A was hitting, kicking,
and attempting to punch staff in the genitals. Staff 6 said she did
not have any concerns with the way in which staff interacted with
Youth A during that incident.
Video Review:
Video footage of March 23, 2024, unit three was reviewed on
April 9, 2024. The duration of the video is 59 minutes and 3
seconds. The video footage is consistent with the interviews of
staff. Throughout the duration of the video footage Youth A is seen
throwing his food across the room, pacing the unit, flipping
furniture over, throwing clothing, shoes and other items around the
8

room, jumping on furniture, jumping from chair to bed to table,
wrapping a shirt around his hands, pacing around the room and
running at staff, attempting to run out of the room, getting items
and attempting to swing them at staff, pulling his pants down and
squatting over a bed, and standing over a trash can with the front
of his pants pulled down. The majority of the time staff are seen
keeping distance from Youth A and moving around the room with
him, giving him space. The staff are seen taking a dustpan handle
and broom from Youth A. There are several instances where Youth
A is crawling and gets near a staff and wraps his hands or legs
around the staff’s legs and they are seen moving in a manner to
get out of Youth A’s grasp and then back away from him. Youth A
is seen sitting in the doorway and staff are taking his shoulders
and sliding him back away from the door. The video does not
show any staff hitting, punching, or kicking Youth A. The staff are
never close enough to Youth A while his pants are pulled down for
them to touch him and are never seen touching Youth A sexually.
Documents Reviewed:
• MiSACWIS Incident Report 178210229 dated March 23,
2024, at 11:20am. The incident report indicates Youth A had
been making suicidal comments, assaulting staff, running
away from the facility, laying in the road, and running into
traffic. The incident resulting in police and EMS involvement
and ultimately Youth A being brought to the hospital for a
psychiatric evaluation.
• MiSACWIS Incident Report 178210233 dated March 23,
2024 at 5:45pm. The incident report is consistent with the
staff’s interviews.
• Youth A hospital records from McLaren Caro dated March
23, 2024 at 13:29. The records report Youth A being
admitted to the hospital due to suicidal ideation and having
been attempting to elope from facility. The records report no
physical concerns and no active suicidal plan in motion
however is deemed eligible for a psychiatric evaluation.
Youth A was evaluated via video conference by Genessee
behavioral health services and deemed eligible to return to
the facility, Youth A was discharged in stable condition.
• Youth A hospital records from McLaren Caro March 23,
2024 at 20:44. The records report Youth A being admitted
for a psychiatric evaluation due to his intention of harming
himself. The report does not show any concerns with his
physical exam, including his head and neck. The report
indicates that Youth A is recommended to go to a
psychiatric inpatient program and was discharged in stable
condition.
9

Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Staff Qualifications, as
there is no evidence that staff hit, punched, kicked, or sexually
touched Youth A.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
